newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Four groups bid for Manila's water privatisation.
newsitem.headline: Four groups bid for Manila's water privatisation.

text.p: All the four shortlisted groups gave their technical and financial proposals on Monday for a 25-year contract to operate and develop two concessions of the Metropolitan Waterworks and Sewerage System (MWSS), officials said.
The groups, made up of local companies and their partners, were each led by the Aboitiz Equity Ventures Inc, Ayala Corp, Benpres Holdings Corp, and Metro Pacific Corp.

Government officials said the technical proposals will be reviewed over two weeks by three independent international engineers. Those who pass the review will have their financial bids opened on January 23, officials said.
Officials said the winning bid would be the one which gives the biggest discount to the existing average tariff rate of 8.78 pesos per cubic metre.
Each group, which has to be 60 percent-owned by local investors and 40 percent by foreign investors, can only win one concession but they are required to submit bids for both.
Aboitiz has as its foreign partner France's Compagnie Generale de Eaux.
Ayala Corp has United Utilities Plc of Great Britain, formerly Northwest Water Group Plc, and Bechtel Corp of the U.S. as its foreign partners.
Benpres Holdings has tied up with France's Lyonnaise des Eaux SA.
Metro Pacific has a joint venture with Anglian Water Plc of Great Britain and Australia Water Technologies Pty Ltd.
The winners are expected to invest $7.0 billion over the next 25 years to imrpove water and sewerage services.
The privatisation programme is aimed at raising water coverage to 98 percent of Metro Manila's people in ten years from the present 68 percent.
Metro Manila's population is around 10 million.
